content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)::String
    words = split(s)
    current_line_length = 0
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        elseif current_line_length > 0
            wrapped_text *= " "
            current_line_length += 1
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= word
        current_line_length += length(word)
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("This is an example string that needs to be wrapped.", 10))
```
